channel.title: If you pray, say one for my dad
channel.description:
My dad has been pretty sick over the last few weeks, it started out as an upset stomach for a few weeks, and over 3 weeks he lost about 30 pounds. Then his skin and eyes started turning yellow and they did some tests. Finally the liver biopsy test came back 2 days ago, and it's confirmed.
He has pancreas cancer which has also moved over to his liver. The doctor said if it was just pancreas cancer they could remove the pancreas, which would make him diabetic but otherwise alright, but since it is also in his liver the only option is to do chemo-therapy and hope and pray it shrinks the cancers. It's all they can do I guess, he goes in for his first treatment Monday. They haven't said anything about a timeline, but from looking up pancreas cancer on the internet it doesn't look very good, so any prayers you could say for him would be much appreciated.
Thanks a lot.

item.title: If you pray, say one for my dad
item.dc:creator: @MujaheD Radeon
item.description:
@MujaheD wrote:

I’m sorry to hear this, I hope he gets better soon. Try to be around your father as much as you can these days.

Read full topic

item.title: If you pray, say one for my dad
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

This sucks.

My Grandpa had a stroke a few months and hardly made it through, and he doesn’t remember how to speak and he hardly remember any of my family. He lives in an assisted living place now any my Grandma is living with my Aunt. We are all just happy he was alive, because for the first week or two he was in and out of good and bad conditions.

Best of luck to your father/in-law!

Read full topic

item.title: If you pray, say one for my dad
item.dc:creator: @srt8 srt8
item.description:
@srt8 wrote:

This is ridiculous. I told MITB to post this about his Dad because the more support the better, but you are proving him right, that this should not have been brought up to the whole community. Heaven is a place that we all want to end up, but do any of you want to lose your parents at a young age??! Grow up. This is the end of all off-topic comments. If you can’t be supportive then don’t post in the thread

Read full topic

Fox News

Police: Girl Dies After Parents Pray for Healing Instead of Seeking Medical Help

An 11-year-old girl died after her parents prayed for healing rather than seek medical help for a treatable form of diabetes, police said Tuesday.

oh so relevant

item.title: If you pray, say one for my dad
item.dc:creator: @Cheese_Police c|p
item.description:
@Cheese_Police wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:30, topic:337206”]I think both Moparisthebest and srt8, even if they haven’t explicitly stated it, would like this topic to remain free of snide remarks and silly pictures.
Of course, both have their place, and we have a plethora of other topics that are far more suitable. But don’t kick someone when they’re down or going through a tough time.[/quote]

Snide remarks? I’m sorry, perhaps you guys are fucking dumb and always assume the worst of a comment. If you don’t have the ability to put some serious thought into reading a potentially negative comment and to try to understand what it actually means, then don’t post a thread where it is the norm. If all you want is ‘oh, that’s so awful, I’m sorry.’, then you are looking for support in the wrong place.

Please note Lothy, that’s not directed at you, even if you were the one who deleted my post (twice).

Oh, sorry I must be off-topic: Wow man, that really sucks. Death is so tragic, allow me to emphasize how sad it is. Hey, at least he will end up in a better place, right?

Read full topic

item.title: If you pray, say one for my dad
item.dc:creator: @srt8 srt8
item.description:
@srt8 wrote:

He was feeling really good yesterday. MITB and his Dad were able to work out in the garage together. Today, his parents were suppose to meet us for Mass at 10:30am and when they left the house he was fine but about 10 mins later he was throwing up in the car. It is insane how fast he gets sick.

Read full topic

I feel for you, I myself have had people in my close family fight against cancer (some successfully and others not :/). That being said make sure you are by your dad’s side as much as possible because he will really need the moral support.
